channel.title: My computer: Good/Bad/Shitty?
channel.description:
So I'm looking to improve my computers performance so I want to know what I should improve.

item.title: My computer: Good/Bad/Shitty?
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

[quote=“Immortal Technique, post:3, topic:408333”][quote author=blakeman8192 link=topic=509616.msg3697428#msg3697428 date=1312525474]
192MB of RAM… holy shit bro ask your computer what Egypt looked like before the pyramids were built because it must have been there dude.
Just buy a whole new computer or something, or get more RAM.
[/quote]

Would buying another 256MB ram stick do anything?[/quote]
My computer has 10GB ram and I still consider it slow. Basically just get a whole new computer cause it will cost less.

Read full topic

item.title: My computer: Good/Bad/Shitty?
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

this right here isnt bad for $200: http://www.newegg.com/Product/ComboBundleDetails.aspx?ItemList=Combo.679888 you will have to buy the thermal paste i assume this is just the parts and u have to build it yourself. since idk if you know how to build a computer im sure there are youtube tutorial videos on how to build a pc and stuff. after thinking about it i dont this that combo comes with sata cables(maybe it does i didnt see though) you would need that to connect the hard drive.

does anyone have that link to the picture that has a list of computer parts that u can buy based on price and type of pc u want to build?

im going to do some looking around and see if i can make a list of stuff for maybe lower but still ok(much better than what u have now) for starters, and is upgradable overtime.

i have came up with a list its a little over $200 but so is the other one the only reason the other is $200 is b/c of the combo discount.

cpu & mobo: http://www.tigerdirect.com/applications/SearchTools/item-details.asp?EdpNo=849382&CatId=4297 - $115 psu & case: http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16811147010 - $40 RAM: http://www.tigerdirect.com/applications/SearchTools/item-details.asp?EdpNo=4531833&CatId=4524 - $25 HDD: http://www.tigerdirect.com/applications/SearchTools/item-details.asp?EdpNo=7281716&CatId=2459 - $40

that is $220 which b4 the combo discount the other one is $230. these prices exclude the prices of the OS, cables, thermal paste, and other accessories needed to build a fully functioning computer. the OS you can always you a linux distro(ive nvr had trouble with ubuntu, other linux distros i have problems with every now and then) the only thing with that is you may not be able to play windows(u can play some windows game and use some windows software with WINE) games on it, what ever OS you choose to use make sure its 64-bit. you can sometimes save money when you buy computer parts in combos, just make sure one of the items in the combo are worth it, if not why would you buy the combo? also do price checks between sites to make sure you get the best deal.

Read full topic

item.title: My computer: Good/Bad/Shitty?
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

[quote=“blakeman8192, post:6, topic:408333”][quote author=Immortal Technique link=topic=509616.msg3697430#msg3697430 date=1312525588]

192MB of RAM… holy shit bro ask your computer what Egypt looked like before the pyramids were built because it must have been there dude.
Just buy a whole new computer or something, or get more RAM.

Would buying another 256MB ram stick do anything?
[/quote]

I don’t even think you can buy a 256MB ram these days… maybe not even 512MB.
A 1GB stick at least, I have 4x4GB sticks (16GB total) in my computer and only spent like $120 on the memory.[/quote]

This is DDR memory we are talking about…

OP, seriously just buy build a new computer. To get your hands on memory that old is actually quite expensive, DDR2 RAM is generally cheaper even though its newer and in theory twice as fast. That CPU is also just as ancient so I’d advise to slap some minimal linux distro on this computer and use it for something like a file server or simply just throw it away

Read full topic

item.title: My computer: Good/Bad/Shitty?
item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

It all depends on the maximum amount of RAM that the motherboard can accept. If it is less than 2GB, I think it’s time to upgrade your motherboard.

item.title: My computer: Good/Bad/Shitty?
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

I coulde put together a lit of computer parts if u wanted to build ur own pc, as long as u have the knowledge how to built a pc u should be good, if u don’t know ask around ur town at computer repair shops if they will build ur pc for u if u bring in the parts, if so find out how much or if u have a friend that know how maybe they can do it for u. I don’t know where ur computer skills are at so idk exact what all u know how to do. I’m going to bed ill check back in a couple hours(4 and a half X0 I need to start sleeping better so I get more sleep, but I do sleep most the day after school(from like 3 to 9) so I catch back up then but id rather not sleep doing the day ) when I wake up.

Read full topic

item.title: My computer: Good/Bad/Shitty?

item.description:

[quote=“Immortal Technique, post:3, topic:408333”][quote author=blakeman8192 link=topic=509616.msg3697428#msg3697428 date=1312525474]
192MB of RAM… holy shit bro ask your computer what Egypt looked like before the pyramids were built because it must have been there dude.
Just buy a whole new computer or something, or get more RAM.
[/quote]

Would buying another 256MB ram stick do anything?[/quote]

I don’t even think you can buy a 256MB ram these days… maybe not even 512MB.
A 1GB stick at least, I have 4x4GB sticks (16GB total) in my computer and only spent like $120 on the memory.

Read full topic

item.title: My computer: Good/Bad/Shitty?
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

id probably say get a newer pc. when was that pc purchased? it all depends on what u want to do with it. i mean the performance would be ok for simple everyday task like web surfing, using office produces and maybe(may have to buy more ram) development but probably not much else.

if u cant get a new pc buying ram is about all u can do, b/c without knowing the year it was made i would guess the ram is ddr2 or older. u can use crucial.com to see how much ram it can use and what u should get but u can buy the ram from where ever as long as it is the correct type and everything.

may be able to upgrade the cpu but probably would be a waste. u could get a video card but u would have to make sure its compatible and stuff, but that would only increase graphic performance.

in all i would save up money for a new computer, either buying is pre-made like most ppl, or compile a list of parts to build a future proof pc u dont have to get the best cpu and ram at first, just getting it to run then save up to upgrade it, but definitely get a future proof motherboard. u have to choose between amd(im not a fan of amd but the price for performance i think is better than intel not sure asking around and do research) and intel(more expensive, but ppl will say its worth it)

anyways that what im going to do when i get a job is save up, to pay off student loans after college, car repair, newer car, new pc build, rent, and bills, etc.

Read full topic

item.title: My computer: Good/Bad/Shitty?
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

[quote=“Immortal Technique, post:3, topic:408333”][quote author=blakeman8192 link=topic=509616.msg3697428#msg3697428 date=1312525474]
192MB of RAM… holy shit bro ask your computer what Egypt looked like before the pyramids were built because it must have been there dude.
Just buy a whole new computer or something, or get more RAM.
[/quote]

Would buying another 256MB ram stick do anything?[/quote]

It would do SOMETHING. Not much… I used to have the same processor and RAM as you. It was a Compaq as well so it might have been the same computer model. I replaced the factory RAM with 768MB and it was still very slow… Window’s left huge trails even. I would just save up money for a new comp if I were you.

Read full topic
